Veeplay Cast Plugin Reference

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
com.veeplay.cast  

Veeplay Cast Plugin Reference

About

The Veeplay Cast Plugin is a plugin for the Veeplay SDK that offers support for Google Cast devices.

Specifically, it adds support for playing APSMediaUnit objects and playlists on a Google Cast enabled device. The plugin itself is a wrapper around the official Cast Companion Library that is widely used among Android Google Cast integrations. As such, this library is dependent on the CCL library as well as it's own dependencies, that are detailed below.

Working with this library is designed to revolve around the VeeplayCastManager singleton. Integration steps are detailed below, but the general workflow is to initialize the VeeplayCastManager singleton, to register the GoogleCastRenderer class with the Veeplay instance, and, optionally, to place additional MediaRouteButtons (used for connecting to a Google Cast device) in the host application.

Setting up the plugin

Host application dependencies

Applications implementing the Veeplay SDK and the Veeplay Cast plugin should add the following dependencies to their project:

  • com.android.support:appcompat-v7:22.0.0
  • com.android.support:mediarouter-v7:22.0.0'
  • appscendVastPlayer (the Veeplay SDK)
  • the Veeplay Cast plugin (this library)

Alternatively, you can easily add the Cast plugin as a Maven dependency: 


      repositories {
        maven {
        url "https://android.veeplay.com.s3.amazonaws.com/releases"
        }
      }
      dependencies {
        compile 'com.veeplay:veeplay-player-android:1.9.21'
      }

Veeplay Cast Plugin module dependencies

For gradle based users, the Veeplay Cast Plugin comes with a build.gradle file that will take care of the library dependencies. The file should be edited in order to mark the correct project names of the CCL library and the Veeplay SDK

ANT users should manually add the following dependencies, either by copying jar files to the libs folder or by specifying project dependencies in Eclipse:

  • com.android.support:appcompat-v7:22.0.0
  • com.google.android.gms:play-services-base:7.0.0
  • com.google.android.gms:play-services-cast:7.0.0'
  • com.android.support:mediarouter-v7:22.0.0'
  • cast-companion-library-android
  • appscendVastPlayer (the Veeplay SDK)

Integrating the plugin

Initializing the components

Before interacting with the VeeplayCastManager singleton, it should be properly initialized. This can be done as early as necessary in the application lifecycle. 

      
        VeeplayCastManager.getInstance().init(this, "E8CDF951", VeeplayActivity.class);

The GoogleCastRenderer and APSMediaRouteButtonOverlayController classes should be registered with the Veeplay instance before trying to play any media units, and it should be re-registered after each call to APSMediaPlayer.getInstance.finish().

The renderer implementation takes care of the media flow between the app and the Cast device.

The APSMediaRouteButtonOverlayController provides an overlay type that can be added to APSMediaUnits in order to display a cast device selection button.

      
        APSMediaPlayer.getInstance().registerClassInGroup(GoogleCastRenderer.class, APSMediaPlayer.kAPSMediaPlayerRenderersGroup, GoogleCastRenderer.rendererIdentifier);
        APSMediaPlayer.getInstance().registerClassInGroup(APSMediaRouteButtonOverlayController.class, APSMediaPlayer.kAPSMediaPlayerOverlayControllersGroup, APSMediaRouteButtonOverlayController.APSMediaRouteOverlay);

Adding a MediaRouteButton overlay to all media units (optional)

The MediaRouteButton will not be displayed when there are no Cast devices available. When there are Google Cast devices available, a button will appear along with the controls visibility, in the top left corner of the overlays container.

      
        ArrayList<APSMediaEvent> mediaUnits = builder.mediaUnits();
        for(APSMediaEvent event : mediaUnits) {
          if(event instanceof APSMediaUnit) {
            ((APSMediaUnit)event).addGoogleCastOverlay();
          }
        }
